channel.title: NPR All Things Considered
channel.description: All Things Considered hosts Ailsa Chang, Mary Louise Kelly, Ari Shapiro, Juana Summers and Scott Detrow present the program's trademark mix of news, interviews, commentaries, reviews, and offbeat features 7 days a week.

item.title: 100 years after evolution went on trial, the Scopes case still reverberates
item.description: One hundred years ago, the small town of Dayton, Tenn., became the unlikely stage for one of the most sensational trials in American history, over the teaching of Darwin's theory of evolution.

item.title: NPR reports from Texas' Kerr County, which saw the worst flooding
item.description: Kerr County, Texas, experienced the worst of the flooding and has seen the highest death toll. NPR's Juana Summers describes the scene where she arrived Monday morning.

item.title: A new book reveals how the Democrats lost America in 2024
item.description: A new book reveals the tensions between Vice President Harris and President Biden — and how it led to Democratic failure in 2024.

item.title: Medicaid's many different names may cause confusion about who's losing coverage
item.description: Medicaid programs go by so many different names across the country that advocates and experts warn people may not know they're losing their coverage until it's too late.

item.title: Meet Diego Luna, the bleach blonde breakout star of USMNT
item.description: The U.S. men's national soccer team came into the Gold Cup missing many of its usual starters — but, in their absence, a 21-year-old bleach blonde Mexican-American winger named Diego Luna stood out.

item.title: The politics of fewer babies
item.description: Families in the U.S. and much of the world are having so few babies, national populations are set to shrink and age. The trend is changing American politics and fueling the rise of global populism.

item.title: Elon Musk's new political party
item.description: Elon Musk says he is launching a new political party. It comes after Musk's explosive breakup with President Trump. Musk has been critical of Republicans' support for Trump's "One Big Beautiful Bill."

item.title: The White House starts announcing new tariff rates as it pushes back its deadline
item.description: President Trump has begun releasing letters announcing new tariff rates that would go into effect on Aug. 1.

item.title: Does listening to an audiobook count as reading?
item.description: One debate that's sure to draw a lot of strong opinions and hot takes — does listening to an audiobook count as reading?

item.title: Clashes over fertile land between herders and farmers in Nigeria turn deadly
item.description: Battles between herders and farmers over access to land in Nigeria's fertile central region have led to violent clashes and no easy answers.
